titleStmt.title: By the King. A proclamation James R. Whereas it hath been represented to us in our councel, that the bakers of this our city of Dublin, (who by vertue of their charter from us, do pretend to exclude all such as are not free of their fraternity, ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II)
James II, King of England, 1633-1701.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Andrew Crook the assign of Benjamin Tooke printer to the King's most excellent Majesty; and are to be sold at his Majesties printing-house on Ormonde-Key,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption title and opening lines of text.
"Given at our court at Dublin-Castle the 18th day of November 1689."
All persons may bake and sell bread in Dublin. Cf. Steele.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
